intro: Duguetia amplexifolia, commonly known as the clinging leaf tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
